name: Haunting Horror
description: Ghosts, spirits, residual energy, unfinished business, the past refusing to stay dead, places that remember

writing_rules.message: WARNING: This theme explores the terror of places that remember. The dead do not always rest quietly. Some memories are too strong to fade.

never_explain_ghosts: Never provide definitive explanations for hauntings. The mystery is the terror.
Never confirm whether ghosts are real or psychological manifestations. Leave room for doubt.
Never resolve the haunting completely. Some questions should remain unanswered.

greetings: You shouldn't have come back. {Spirit} never left.
The {object} is in the wrong place. It wasn't there {time_ago}.
You feel {emotion} when you enter {room}. It wasn't always this way.
The {past_event} never really ended. You can still hear {sound}.
They say the {location} is haunted. They're right.
The {spirit} is watching you. It always has been.
greetings_internal_monologue: {self_question}: Why does {location} feel so {adjective}? I've never been here before... have I?
{uncertainty}: The {object} {behavior} when I {action}. {self_correction} No, it's always {behavior}.
farewells: The {location} will remember you. {Spirit} will be waiting.
Don't look back. {Entity} is still watching.
The {past_event} isn't over. It never will be.
You can leave, but {spirit} will follow.
The {haunting} continues. You were just part of it.
Some doors should stay closed. You've opened one.
The {memory} will stay with you. It always does.

templates: A {adjective} {location} where the {past_event} never ended. {player_action} awakens {spirit}.
The {building} is haunted by {entity}. {manifestation} occurs when {condition}. {objective}.
A {subgenre} game where {residual_energy} replays the {tragedy}. {mechanic} determines your fate.
The {past} and {present} are blurring. {player_action} accelerates the {merging}.
The {location} is a nexus of {paranormal_activity}. {player_action} attracts {attention}.
locations: house where a family was murdered
hospital where patients died in agony
theater where an actor died on stage
asylum where patients were experimented on
entities: a ghost reliving its final moments
a residual energy imprint of a traumatic event
a poltergeist fueled by negative emotions
a demonic entity posing as a ghost
a collective consciousness of past victims
a guardian spirit protecting a secret
a time-displaced entity from another era
manifestations: shadow figures seen in peripheral vision
doors opening and closing by themselves
feelings of being watched or touched

temporal_confusion: Describe {event} as if it's happening now, then reveal it happened {time_ago}.
Show {character} experiencing {past_event} as if it's the present.
Note how {object} appears {different_state} at different times.
emotional_resonance: Describe how {location} makes {character} feel {emotion} without obvious cause.
Create {situation} where {emotion} lingers long after the event.
ambiguous_manifestations: Show {character} experiencing {event} that may or may not be real.
Note how {manifestation} {behavior} in ways that defy {natural_laws|logic}.

murder_house.central_paradox: The house appears normal, but the violence that occurred there has left an indelible mark. The past and present coexist uneasily.
untrustworthy_elements: bloodstains that reappear after cleaning
rooms that feel colder than others for no reason
objects that move when unobserved
voices that whisper when alone
reflections that don't match reality
memories that surface unexpectedly
the sense of being watched from empty rooms

abandoned_asylum.central_paradox: The asylum was meant to heal, but the suffering that occurred within its walls has created a nexus of negative energy. The building itself seems alive with pain.
untrustworthy_elements: patient records that change when unobserved
doors that lead to different rooms
sounds of suffering with no source
shadows that move against the light
the smell of antiseptic that lingers
whispers in languages no one understands
the feeling of being restrained when free

cursed_theater.central_paradox: The theater was built for entertainment, but the tragedies that occurred on its stage have turned it into a place of horror. The show must go on... forever.
untrustworthy_elements: props that move between scenes
applause heard when the theater is empty
actors who appear in reflections but not in person
scripts that change overnight
the smell of greasepaint and blood
voices that whisper lines from unwritten plays
the sense of being on stage when you're not

revelation_patterns: The {haunting} isn't just {spirit} - it's {residual_energy} from {past_event}. The {implication} is {consequence}.
{Location} doesn't just {contain} {spirit} - it {amplifies} them. This suggests {hidden_purpose}.
The {manifestation} wasn't {random} - it was triggered by {player_action}. The {spirit} is {reacting} to you specifically.
{Entity} isn't just {ghost} - it's {something_else}. But {evidence_of_ghost} complicates this understanding.
The {haunting} doesn't follow {normal_rules} - it operates on {different_principles}. This explains {unexplained_phenomena}.
